problem: Given J is the midpoint of GI. J is the midpoint of FH and GI . Complete the proof that HI∥FG . (Elements:  ∠HJI ,  ∠FGJ ,  GJ ,  ∠HIJ ,  △HIJ ,  FG ,  HJ ,  ∠FJG ,  IJ ,  FJ ,  △FGJ ,  HI , )
statement: J is the midpoint of FH
J is the midpoint of GI
reason: Converse of Alternate Interior Angles Theorem
